pull.title: policy: Remove promiscuousmempoolflags
pull.body: It seems odd to clutter validation code with features that can only ever be used for testing (testnet or regtest). Removing that test-only code makes the mempool logic less painful to understand and easier to reason about when changed or refactored in the future.

verification.payload:
tree 659d9cc2737a388a465b3c6b0543ec0b34dcba52
parent 6579d80572d2d33aceabbd3db45a6a9f809aa5e3
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1529785014 -0400
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1529787772 -0400

policy: Remove promiscuousmempoolflags

events.body: As a side note: The current implementation is broken anyway because it returns a dirty `state` in some cases, but doesn't fail to add the transaction to the mempool. See explanation in the first comment of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13407#issue-193085240

Concept ACK.
Though I wonder why this was the case. Does removing this reduce test coverage?

I believe this increases overall test coverage.

Clearly by removing (partly untested) code in ATMP the coverage increases there. Though, to the best of my knowledge the runtime error of ("TestBlockValidity failed") in `miner` is no longer covered. If you think this coverage is important, I am happy to volunteer to write a unit test for this, but I think introducing bugs in other modules just so that we can abuse functional tests for an increase in line coverage is not the way to go.
@morcos You introduced this in 4f7ff004978. Any comments?

I'm a bit rusty on all this code, but in principle I'm fine with no longer having that flag.

Concept ACK
utACK faa24441ec047ec336b86f586016b9d318c1c0ad. I didn't review the test changes.

After merging this there are still a couple mentions of `-promiscuousmempoolflags`:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/8803c9132a78d8182bd828a29f7051fc7688f934/src/init.cpp#L349
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/8803c9132a78d8182bd828a29f7051fc7688f934/test/lint/check-doc.py#L25
@fanquake This is wanted. We could remove those in the version that follows the version which includes this pull request.

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
